post_text:
My thesis argument is that many Muslims acknowledge the fact that child marriage is an unjustifiable act and representative of a primitive, archaic moral system that is incompatible in this day and age. When confronted with the idea that Prophet Muhammad himself practiced this with his marriage to Aisha, they come up with arguments that are not based in reality and are untruthful and based on contradictory value systems.


Aisha was 6 when Muhammad asked her father, Abu Bakr, (also his closest friend) to marry her after having a dream of an angel carrying a young girl covered in a blanket and bringing her to him when he lifted the veil, he saw that it was Aisha. He interpreted this dream as a command from Allah to marry her. When he proposed the marriage to her, she remained silent and Muhammad said “her silence is her consent”. Aisha then moved into Muhammad’s house when she was 9, which is when the marriage was consummated. A 53 year old Muhammad had raped a 9 year old girl

Where do the reports that Aisha married Muhammad when she was 6 come from? They come from Sahih Bukhari and Sahih Muslim. Sahih Bukhari is the second most important book in Islam after the Quran, and the most authentic book of hadiths, Sahih Muslim is also considered the most authentic and trusted book of hadiths. A very large part of Islamic history, tradition, rules, laws, jurisprudence stems from these two books. Not only is her age being 6 when she was married  said explicitly in Bukhari and Muslim, but other books in the Kutub al Sitah (which is the 6 most authentic books of hadiths in Islam) Which is why it annoys me so much when Muslim apologists say that the hadiths that say Aisha was 6 are weak hadiths in an attempt to trick laymen and unknowledgeable people, when the exact opposite is true. The hadiths that say Aisha was 6 are considered authentic/trusted. I will post them in the comments https://www.reddit.com/r/DebateReligion/comments/nqkv7h/the_arguments_that_muslim_apologists_put_forth_in/h0b8462/?utm_source=share&utm_medium=ios_app&utm_name=iossmf&context=3

Another trick that Muslim apologists employ is that they downplay the significance of the hadiths and claim hadiths in general are just unreliable as they were compiled many years after the death of Muhammad. They claim hadiths are just secondary Islamic sources and not as authoritative, definitive, or significant in Islam. That is a complete and utter falsehood, it is so laughably false, because there is a 99.9999% chance that the same people saying that do actually believe in the hadiths and recognize the hadiths significance in Islam, but are just saying that to save face. Also the Quran was complied into one text many years after the death of Muhammad too and were a compilation of many verses written on rocks to leaves over the course of 20 years, and Qurans with different Arabic dialects were discarded in n favour of one Arabic dialect

The Quran is actually a quite shallow book and reveals virtually zero personal details about Muhammad or his companions as the Quran is only what Allah was saying to Muhammad depending on the circumstances Muhammad was in. The way Muslims pray, the stories of the end times, Islamic rituals, all the battles that Muhammad participated in, his interactions with his companions, all the major stories in Islam, the personal life and details of Muhammad come from hadiths. The majority of Islamic law is derived from hadiths and the seerah. You cannot have Islam without the hadiths. Period. 99% of Muhammad’s life is discovered through the hadiths and seerah. You wouldn’t know 99% of Muhammad’s life by going with the Quran alone.

People who only take the Quran into consideration and reject the authority of hadiths are considered infidels by almost all Islamic scholars. But even then Quran 65:4 is a clear indication that child marriages are permitted in Islam, as it states that girls who have not yet menstruated have a waiting period of 3 months before they remarry

Some Muslim apologists say there are some hadiths that say Aisha was actually 12/14/18 at the time of the narriage: THIS IS FALSE. There is no hadith out there that EXPLICITLY say that Aisha was 12 or 14 or 18 at the time of the marriage. Some Muslim apologists have deduced Aisha’s age from certain hadiths, but no hadiths explicitly say that.

However, there are 20+ hadiths that explicitly state that Aisha was 6 and played with dolls and sat on the lap of Muhammad, all of them authentic and trusted or that she was a young girl or allude/imply that she was very young

The 3 other arguments Muslim apologists use are: 1) Aisha’s sister, Asma was 10 years older than Aisha, and from a hadith that states the date of her death and the age at which she died, we can determine Aisha’s birth year , and hence that Aisha was 18 at the time of the marriage . The issue here is that this report is considered inauthentic/untrustworthy/weak by Islamic scholars and the text from which this report came from is discarded and considered unreliable by Islamic scholars. Ironic because Muslim apologists say that the hadiths that say Aisha was 6 are weak hadiths, but they are actually using weak hadiths themselves. Look up ʿAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Abī al-Zinād, the one who authored Asmas biography and Islamic scholars’ opinions on him and whether or not his work is authentic 

2) Muhammad’s daughter Fatima was 5 years older than Aisha, and using the birth year of Fatima as a reference point and adding 5 yrs to it to get Aisha’s birth year, we can determine Aisha was actually 12 at the time of the marriage. The issue here is this: There are 2 reports, one says that Fatima was born in the year of 605, and another separate report that says she was born in 611 and she was 5 years older than Aisha. What Muslim apologists did was they used the first report that Fatima was born in the year of 605 and then inserted that she was 5 years older than Aisha, when the first report did not say Fatima was 5 years older than Aisha. They deceptively inserted the second contradictory report with the first one to make Aishas age older. The second report would actually make Aisha’s age out to be 4 years old when she was married rather than 6

3) Aisha participated in a battle shortly after their marriage  and Muhammad only allowed people 15 or older to participate in battles, so Aisha was actually 13/14 at the time of the marriage. The issue is that Aisha was not a combatant in the battle, she was acting as a nurse, so the minimum age of 15 did not apply to her.

Other notes: Muhammad married a 17 year old Saafiya when he was 58, a 19 year old Hafsa when he was 53, a 20 year old Juwariya when he was 57, and married all of his daughters off before or at the age of 10, which further proves Muhammad was okay with this kind of stuff of marrying women much younger than him
